name: Google Slides
title: Google Slides

children.text: With Google Slides modules in Make, you can create, update, list, and/or delete presentations and upload images to presentations in your Google Slides account.
To use the Google Slides modules, you must have a Google Slides account with slides and/or presentations in your Google Drive. You can create an account at
for a list of available endpoints.
Make's use and transfer of information received from Google APIs to any other app will adhere to
Google API Services User Data Policy
To establish the connection in Make:
Log in to your Make account, add a Google Slides module to your
field, enter a name for the connection.
toggle and enter your Google Cloud Platform project client credentials. For more information, see the

data.label: Google Slides
data.overridedLabel: Create and configure a Google Cloud Platform project for Google Slides

children.text: If prompted, authenticate your account and confirm access.
You have successfully established the connection. You can now edit your
and add more Google Slides modules. If your connection requires reauthorization at any point, follow the connection renewal steps
Create and configure a Google Cloud Platform project for Google Slides
To connect to Make using your own client credentials, you can create and configure a project in the Google Cloud Platform.
Create a Google Cloud Platform project for Google Slides
To create a Google Cloud Platform project:
In the top menu, check if your new project is selected in the
dropdown. If not, select the project you just created.
To create a new project or work in the existing one, you need to have the
permission. If you don’t have this permission, ask the Google Cloud Platform Project Owner or Project IAM Admin to grant it to you.
Open the left navigation menu and go to
Google Slides API, Google Drive API
Click the relevant API, then click

status, you will be required to reauthorize your connection in Make every week. To avoid weekly reauthorization, update the project status to
If you update your project to the

After connecting the app, you can perform the following actions:
Triggers when a new presentation is created or updated.

data.label: Google Slides
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Google Slides account.

children.text: Select whether you want to watch created or modified documents.
The maximum number of presentations Make should return during one
Retrieves a list of all presentations.

data.label: Google Slides
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Google Slides account.

children.text: Select the drive that contains the presentation you want to list.
option is available only for Google Workspace users:
- Request the list of drives that require admin access.
Select the folder that contains the presentations you want to list.
The maximum number of presentations Make should return during one
Gets the latest version of a specified presentation.

data.label: Google Slides
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Google Slides account.

children.text: Select the drive that contains a presentation you want to retrieve.
option is available only for Google Workspace users:
- Request the list of drives that require admin access.
Select the Presentation ID whose details you want to retrieve.
Gets the latest version of the specified page or the thumbnail of a page in the presentation.

data.label: Google Slides
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Google Slides account.

children.text: Enter a Presentation and Page ID
Select whether you want to manually enter the Presentation ID and Page Object ID or to select them from the dropdown list.
Select the drive that contains a presentation whose page or thumbnail you want to retrieve.
option is available only for Google Workspace users:
- Request the list of drives that require admin access.
Select or map the presentation whose page you want to retrieve.
Select or map the page you want to retrieve or whose thumbnail you want to retrieve.
Select if you want to get the thumbnail URL in the output.
Create a Presentation From a Template
Creates a new presentation by replacing all tags, for example,
in a template with provided data.

data.label: Google Slides
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Google Slides account.

children.text: Enter a name for the presentation.
Select to map the ID of the presentation for copying or select the presentation from the dropdown menu.
Enter or map the path to the presentation or the ID of the presentation for copying.
Tag  	  Enter the tag associated with the presentation template. Do not use {{}}.     Replaced Value  	  Enter the value of the tag.
Select the drive that contains a presentation whose template you want to copy.
option is available only for Google Workspace users:
Request the list of drives that require admin access.
Select or map the Presentation ID whose template you want to copy.
Select the drive where you want to store a new presentation.
Select the folder where you want to store a new presentation.
Select if you want to share a new presentation.
Enter email addresses of people who you want to share a new presentation with. If you leave the field empty, the presentation is sharable to everyone.
Upload an Image To a Presentation
Uploads an image with URL to a presentation.
Note: The maximum image size is 50 MB. The image resolution must not exceed 25 megapixels. Only PNG, JPEG, or GIF formats are supported.

data.label: Google Slides
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Google Slides account.

children.text: Select to map the ID of the presentation for editing or select the presentation from the dropdown menu.
Select the drive that contains a presentation where you want to insert an image.
option is available only for Google Workspace users:
- Request the list of drives that require admin access.
Select or map the Presentation ID where you want to insert an image.
Select the method you want to use to insert an image.
Upload an Image by Replacing Text Tag
to replace the text with an image.
Enter the tag associated with the presentation. Do not use {{}}.
- Enter the URL of the image you want to insert.
Upload an Image by Replacing Image
- Enter the ID of the image you want to replace.
- Enter the URL of the image you want to insert.
Refreshes the chart data stored in a presentation specified by ID.

data.label: Google Slides
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Google Slides account.

children.text: Select to map the ID of the presentation for refreshing or select the presentation from the dropdown menu.
Select the drive that contains a presentation where you want to refresh a chart.
option is available only for Google Workspace users:
- Request the list of drives that require admin access.
Select or map the Presentation ID where you want to refresh a chart.
Enter the ID of the chart you want to refresh.
Creates an empty slide or delete an existing slide in the specified presentation.

data.label: Google Slides
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Google Slides account.

children.text: Select the action you want to apply to the presentation.
Select or map the presentation where you want to add or delete a slide, or enter the Presentation ID manually.
Select whether you want to manually enter the Slide ID or to select the slide from the dropdown list.
To manually enter the Slide ID, use the field:
- Enter the ID of the slide you want to delete.
Select the layout that you want to apply for a slide in the presentation.
Enter the content of the slide in relevant fields.
Create a Slide from a Template Slide
Creates a new slide by representing all tags, for example,
from a template slide within a specified presentation.

data.label: Google Slides
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Google Slides account.

children.text: Create a Slide from a Template Slide
Select whether you want to manually enter the Slide ID or to select the slide from the dropdown list.
Select the drive that contains the presentation with a slide you want to use as a template.
option is available only for Google Workspace users:
- Request the list of drives that require admin access.
Select or map the presentation where you want to create a slide from a template slide.
Enter the ID of the slide you want to use as a template.
The Slide ID can be found at the end of the URL of the slide you want to use. For example,
in Google Slides to see the slide in the dropdown list.
- Enter the tag associated with the presentation template. Do not use
- Enter the value of the tag.
Enter the page index that you want to append a new slide to.
Performs an arbitrary authorized API call.

data.label: Google Slides
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Google Slides account.

children.text: For the list of available endpoints, refer to the
Select the HTTP method you want to use:
: To retrieve information for an entry.
: To make a partial entry update.
Enter the desired request headers. You don't have to add authorization headers; we already did that for you.
Enter the body content for your API call.
Makes all links in a presentation clickable or inserts a link into all matched input texts.

data.label: Google Slides
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Google Slides account.

children.text: Select to map the ID of the presentation that contains links or select the presentation from the dropdown menu.
Select the drive that contains the documents with links.
option is available only for Google Workspace users:
- Request the list of drives that require admin access.
Select or map the presentation where you want to insert a link or make all links clickable.
Select the action to apply to links in the presentation.
Insert a link to a specific piece of text.
Enter the text where you want to put a link.

customCSS:
<style>
@media print {
  html, body {
    overflow-x: visible;
  }
}
#tally-widget-button {
  position: fixed !important;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  display: none;
  visibility: visible !important;
  opacity: 1 !important;
  color: #0C121D;
  border: 2px solid #0C121D;
  border-radius: 4px;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  font-size: 14px;
  font-weight: 600;
  font-family: 'Inter';
  text-align: center;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
  cursor: pointer;
  z-index: 999999 !important;
  -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;
  outline: none;
  touch-action: manipulation;
  pointer-events: auto;
  transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
}
.button-text {
  display: inline-block;
  margin-right: 8px;
}
.button-text::before {
  content: attr(data-text);
}
#tally-widget-popup {
  position: fixed;
  background-color: white;
  display: none;
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 10px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
  z-index: 999999;
  overflow: hidden;
  border: 0px solid #0C121D;
  padding-top: 30px;
}
#tally-widget-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 10px;
  right: 10px;
  background: none;
  border: none;
  font-size: 36px;
  font-weight: bold;
  padding: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
  color: #0C121D;
}

  .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
    font-family: 'Inter' !important;
  }

  .dark .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #F6F6F6 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column > div > div > div.flex.flex-1.w-full.justify-center.pb-0 > div > div.flex.items-center.pl-0.pr-2.mb-5.xl\:-mt-1\.5 > div > div > div > div:nth-child(1) > div.flex.pr-2.text-gray-500.items-center {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  a.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-public-space-links-wrap .ab-public-space-link:first-of-type {
    border-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-toc-item-active a{
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 {
    text-decoration-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-left:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .ab-nav-left-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-right:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .ab-nav-right-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
#tally-inline-popup {
  position: fixed;
  display: none;
  z-index: 999999;
  width: min(420px, 90vw);
  height: min(550px, 80vh);
  background: #fff;
  color: #0c121d;
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.08);
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 12px 28px rgba(0,0,0,0.22), 0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.12);
  overflow: hidden;
  padding: 5px;
}

#tally-inline-popup iframe {
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  border: 0;
  display: block;
  border-radius: 8px;
}

#tally-inline-popup .tip-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 6px;
  right: 8px;
  width: 32px;
  height: 32px;
  line-height: 28px;
  font-size: 22px;
  text-align: center;
  background: rgba(255,255,255,0.85);
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.06);
  border-radius: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
}

#main-column a[data-form-url],
#main-column a[data-tally-url] {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
  text-decoration: underline;
  text-underline-offset: 2px;
  text-decoration-thickness: 1.5px;
  font-weight: 600;
}

@media (max-width: 640px) {
  #tally-inline-popup {
    width: min(360px, 94vw);
    height: min(500px, 80vh);
  }
}

#main-column .ab-cta-button a.ab-cta-button {
  background-color: #7302D5;
}

/* Titles in purple */
.ab-link-blocks-wrapper .ab-link-block-item.ab-docs-card-mode .ab-link-block-content-wrap .font-bold {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
}

.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
}

</style>

reusableContentVariables.name: string
reusableContentVariables.description: a list or sequence of characters (like letters, numbers, and symbols) used to represent text in a computer programming.

reusableContentVariables.name: Operations
reusableContentVariables.description: An operation is a single module run to process data or check for new data.

reusableContentVariables.name: Credits
reusableContentVariables.description: Credits (formerly operations) are the currency for running scenarios.

reusableContentVariables.name: Route
reusableContentVariables.description: A route is a path that data can flow through in a scenario, visualized as the dotted lines between modules.
